bug.title: First Dataset Using Second's Alpha Value in Line Chart
bug.body: I noticed some odd behavior when using dual line charts. I wanted to have one data series shown as a line and another data series of discrete values with only the data points plotted. Idea was to make the second graph line invisible setting its alpha value to 0. - start off e.g. with the dual line chart sample - use ARGB values for the colors of both graphs - first graph's mode set to LINEAR - make the second graph disappear by setting its alpha value to 0 - change first graph's mode to HORIZONTAL_BEZIER or CUBIC_BEZIER - the first graph and its fill disappear Playing with different alpha values, it turns out that the first graph's color and fill both use the second graph's alpha value if HORIZONTAL_BEZIER or CUBIC_BEZIER mode are selected. ´ (This is using MPAndrroidChart version 3.0.0 beta.) **Modified Code from the LineChartActivity2 sample:** ``` set1 = new LineDataSet(yVals1, "DataSet 1"); set1.setAxisDependency(AxisDependency.LEFT); //set1.setColor(ColorTemplate.getHoloBlue()); set1.setColor(0xffff0000); set1.setCircleColor(Color.WHITE); set1.setLineWidth(2f); set1.setCircleRadius(3f); set1.setFillAlpha(65); set1.setDrawFilled(true); set1.setMode(LineDataSet.Mode.HORIZONTAL_BEZIER); set1.setFillColor(ColorTemplate.getHoloBlue()); set1.setHighLightColor(Color.rgb(244, 117, 117)); set1.setDrawCircleHole(false); // create a dataset and give it a type set2 = new LineDataSet(yVals2, "DataSet 2"); set2.setAxisDependency(AxisDependency.RIGHT); //set2.setColor(Color.RED); set2.setColor(0x0000ff00); set2.setCircleColor(Color.WHITE); set2.setLineWidth(2f); set2.setMode(LineDataSet.Mode.HORIZONTAL_BEZIER); set2.setCircleRadius(3f); set2.setFillAlpha(65); set2.setFillColor(Color.RED); set2.setDrawCircleHole(false); set2.setHighLightColor(Color.rgb(244, 117, 117)); ```

bug.title: Issue with setFillAlpha when used with cubic-lines
bug.body: I am developing an app that is utilising the line chart. I am adding data to my chart and to the LineDataSet I have the following code snippet. ``` Java LineDataSet set1 = new LineDataSet(yVals, "Total crashes during the week"); set1.disableDashedLine(); set1.setColor(Color.BLUE); set1.setDrawFilled(true); set1.setLineWidth(2f); set1.setDrawCubic(true); set1.setFillColor(Color.BLUE); set1.setFillAlpha(65); ``` I am setting the fill alpha to be 65 so the fill of the line chart is slightly transparent, this does work until I then also use `setDrawCubic(true)`, the fill alpha then seems to get ignored and instead the fill colour is completely opaque. I get the same result when togging the cubic mode from the MPAndroidChart example app as well.

bug.title: Bug when turning off the screen
bug.body: In your example, open a line plot, zoom in and turn off the screen. When tuning the screen on again, it will recalculate the zoom offset, jumping to a new location. For example if you show Y values 30-70, next time you turn the screen on it will display 60-100, turn off and on the screen it will display 90-130 etc. The bug is only when zoomed in.
